title: 1970s Blockbusters
description: The decade that changed Hollywood forever! Test your knowledge of the mega-hits that defined 1970s cinema.

questions.question: Which 1975 Steven Spielberg film about a great white shark is considered the first modern blockbuster?
In 'Star Wars' (1977), who played the young hero Luke Skywalker?
Which 1972 film directed by Francis Ford Coppola begins with the line 'I believe in America'?
In 'The Exorcist' (1973), Linda Blair played a girl possessed by a demon. What was her character's name?
Robert Redford and Paul Newman reunited for which 1973 film about a pair of con men?
options: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid

questions.question: Which 1976 film about a down-and-out boxer from Philadelphia became a surprise hit and won Best Picture?
Sylvester Stallone both wrote and starred in 'Rocky.' True or false -- the studio originally wanted another actor for the lead role?
options: False -- Stallone was always the first choice

questions.question: Which 1977 film starring John Travolta sparked a disco craze worldwide?
In 'Close Encounters of the Third Kind' (1977), which musical notes do the aliens communicate with?
Which 1979 Ridley Scott science fiction film features the tagline 'In space no one can hear you scream'?
Which 1978 film starring Christopher Reeve brought a beloved comic book hero to the big screen?
In 'Grease' (1978), who played Sandy opposite John Travolta's Danny?
Which disaster film from 1974 featured an all-star cast trapped in a burning skyscraper?
Martin Sheen starred in which 1979 Francis Ford Coppola film set during the Vietnam War?
